IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: BRAVEN'S MISSION IS TO EMPOWER FIRST-GENERATION COLLEGE STUDENTS, STUDENTS OF COLOR, AND THOSE FROM LOW-INCOME BACKGROUNDS BY EQUIPPING THEM WITH SKILLS, NETWORKS, EXPERIENCES, AND CONFIDENCE TO SECURE STRONG FIRST JOBS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: BRAVEN'S MISSION IS TO EMPOWER FIRST-GENERATION COLLEGE STUDENTS, STUDENTS OF COLOR, AND THOSE FROM LOW-INCOME BACKGROUNDS BY EQUIPPING THEM WITH SKILLS, NETWORKS, EXPERIENCES, AND CONFIDENCE TO SECURE STRONG FIRST JOBS.
IRS990.Desc: BRAVEN SUPPORTS UNTAPPED STUDENTS FROM COLLEGE TO CAREER BY PARTNERING WITH INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER ED AND EMPLOYERS TO OFFER A TWO-PART EXPERIENCE THAT BEGINS WITH A CREDIT-BEARING COLLEGE COURSE FOLLOWED BY A POST-COURSE EXPERIENCE THAT LASTS THROUGH GRADUATION. FELLOWS EMERGE FROM BRAVEN WITH THE SKILLS, CONFIDENCE, EXPERIENCES AND NETWORKS THEY NEED TO LAND A STRONG FIRST JOB AND GET ON A PATH TO ECONOMIC FREEDOM.BRAVEN ALSO DELIVERS BRAVENX, A STIPEND-BASED PROGRAM OUTSIDE OF INSTITUTES OF HIGHER ED, WITH THE GOAL OF EXTENDING THE CRITICAL WORK OF COLLEGE SUCCESS ORGANIZATIONS AND CHARTER HIGH SCHOOLS INTO STRONG CAREER OUTCOMES AFTER COLLEGE. BY PARTNERING WITH SUCH ORGANIZATIONS, BRAVEN HELPS ENSURE THAT THEIR ALUMNI NOT ONLY GRADUATE, ENROLL AND PERSIST IN COLLEGE, BUT ALSO BUILD THE FOUNDATION FOR A LIFELONG CAREER PATH. BRAVENX IS IDENTICAL IN CONTENT AND COHORT STRUCTURE AS OUR CORE PRODUCT, THE HIGHER ED MODEL. IN LIEU OF ACADEMIC CREDIT, BRAVENX FELLOWS EARN A FINANCIAL STIPEND UPON COMPLETION OF THE PROGRAM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BRAVEN'S CEO, HEAD OF HIGHER EDUCATION PARTNERS & PUBLIC POLICY, CHIEF EXTERNAL AFFAIRS OFFICER, AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTORS LOBBIED TO INCORPORATE MORE OF A FOCUS ON CAREER INTO HIGHER EDUCATION MATTERS ON THE NATIONAL LEVEL. BRAVEN ALSO RETAINED THE SERVICES OF A PUBLIC POLICY FIRM TO SUPPORT THIS WORK. EXPENSES IN LINE 1G AND LINE 1I INCLUDE A PORTION OF THE SALARY OF THESE INDIVIDUALS AND FEES PAID TO THE PUBLIC POLICY FIRM.

BRAVEN LEASES EMPLOYEES FROM A PROFESSIONAL EMPLOYMENT ORGANIZATION, TRINET. THE EMPLOYEES ARE CONSIDERED COMMON LAW EMPLOYEES OF BRAVEN, HOWEVER, TRINET IS THE EMPLOYER OF RECORD AND EMPLOYEES GET THEIR W2S FROM TRINET.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PREPARED FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE CONTROLLER, CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER, AND THE CHIEF FINANCIAL AND OPERATIONS OFFICER AND PROVIDED TO THE MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BODY BEFORE THE RETURN IS FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL BOARD MEMBERS DISCLOSE AND SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ANNUALLY. ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ARE REVIEWED AT THE BOARD LEVEL. A DIRECTOR OR OFFICER WITH A CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS PROHIBITED FROM PARTICIPATING IN DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS REGARDING THE TRANSACTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS DETERMINED THE CEO'S COMPENSATION USING DATA ON COMPENSATION PAID BY COMPARABLE ORGANIZATIONS FOR SIMILAR SERVICES. THE COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AT THE END OF THE FISCAL YEAR. THE ORGANIZATION'S MANAGEMENT DETERMINED THE KEY EMPLOYEE'S COMPENSATION USING OUTSIDE BENCHMARKING BASED UPON COST OF LABOR BY REGION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

CONSULTING: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 2,230,583. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 140,038. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 83,221. TOTAL EXPENSES 2,453,842. RESEARCH STUDY FEES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 7,475. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 0. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 7,475. OTHER PROFESSIONAL FEES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 118,998. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 13,404. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 575. TOTAL EXPENSES 132,977.
